English

English Wikipedia has an article on:
Zucker
Wikipedia

Etymology

[edit]
Etymology tree
Proto-Indo-European *ḱorkeh₂
Proto-Indo-Iranian *ćárkaraH
Proto-Indo-Aryan *śárkaraH
Sanskrit शर्करा (śárkarā)
Gandhari 𐨭𐨐𐨪 (śakara)bor.
Middle Persian 𐭱𐭪𐭥 (šakar)bor.
Arabic سُكَّر (sukkar)bor.
Italian zuccherobor.
Middle High German zucker
German Zuckerbor.
English Zucker

    Borrowed from German Zucker.

    Pronunciation

    [edit]
    • (Received Pronunciation) IPA(key): /ˈzʌ.kə/
    • (General American) IPA(key): /ˈzʌ.kəɹ/
    • Audio (Southern England):(file)
    • Rhymes: -ʌkə(ɹ)
    • Hyphenation: Zuc‧ker

    Proper noun

    [edit]

    Zucker (plural Zuckers)

    1. A surname from German.

    Related terms

    [edit]
    • Cukier
    • Cukierman
    • Cukiermann

    • Zuckerman
    • Zuckermann

    • Zukerberg
    • Zukerman
    • Zukermann

    Noun

    [edit]

    Zucker (plural Zuckers)

    2. Ellipsis of Zucker rat.
      • 2012, Obesity: New Insights for the Healthcare Professional, page 56:
        Obese Zuckers, compared to leans, consumed more food under free-feeding conditions.

    Further reading

    [edit]
    • Zucker (surname) on Wikipedia.Wikipedia

    German

    [edit]

    Pronunciation

    [edit]
    • IPA(key): /ˈt͡sʊ.kɐ/
    • Audio:(file)
    • Audio (Berlin):(file)
    • Audio (Austria):(file)
    • Rhymes: -ʊkɐ
    • Hyphenation: Zu‧cker

    Etymology 1

    [edit]
    Etymology tree
    Proto-Indo-European *ḱorkeh₂
    Proto-Indo-Iranian *ćárkaraH
    Proto-Indo-Aryan *śárkaraH
    Sanskrit शर्करा (śárkarā)
    Gandhari 𐨭𐨐𐨪 (śakara)bor.
    Middle Persian 𐭱𐭪𐭥 (šakar)bor.
    Arabic سُكَّر (sukkar)bor.
    Italian zuccherobor.
    Middle High German zucker
    German Zucker

      From Middle High German zucker, from Old High German zuckar, from early Italian zucchero, from Arabic سُكَّر (sukkar), from Persian شکر (šakar), from Sanskrit शर्करा (śárkarā, “grit, gravel; ground or candied sugar”). Cognates include Czech cukr, Hungarian cukor and Dutch suiker.

      Alternative forms

      [edit]
      • Zukker

      Noun

      [edit]

      Zucker m (strong, genitive Zuckers, plural Zucker)

      1. (usually uncountable) sugar
        ein Stück Zucker ― a lump of sugar
      2. (uncountable, slightly informal) diabetes
        Synonyms: Diabetes, Zuckerkrankheit
        Zucker haben ― to be a diabetic
      Declension
      [edit]
      Declension of Zucker [masculine, strong]
      singular plural
      indef. def. noun def. noun
      nominative ein der Zucker die Zucker
      genitive eines des Zuckers der Zucker
      dative einem dem Zucker den Zuckern
      accusative einen den Zucker die Zucker

      Descendants
      [edit]
      • → Czech: cukr
      • → Kashubian: cëczer
      • → Estonian: suhkur
      • → Livonian: sukkur
        • → Latvian: cukurs
          • → Livonian: tsukkõr
      • → Hungarian: cukor
      • → Lower Sorbian: cukor
      • → Polish: cukier
        • → Old Ruthenian: цꙋкоръ (cukor), цу́коръ (cúkor), цю́коръ (cjúkor)
          • Belarusian: цу́кар (cúkar)
          • Carpathian Rusyn: цу́кор (cúkor)
          • Ukrainian: цу́кор (cúkor); цу́кар (cúkar), цу́кер (cúker), цу́кур (cúkur) (dialectal)
      • → Serbo-Croatian:
        Cyrillic script: цу̏кар, цу̏кер
        Latin script: cȕkar, cȕker
      • → Slovene: cuker
      • → Slovak: cukor
      • → Upper Sorbian: cokor

      Proper noun

      [edit]

      Zucker m or f (proper noun, surname, masculine genitive Zuckers or (with an article) Zucker, feminine genitive Zucker, plural Zuckers or Zucker)

      1. a surname
      Related terms
      [edit]
      • Zuckerberg
      • Zuckermann
      Descendants
      [edit]
      • English: Zucker
      • Polish: Cukier

      Etymology 2

      [edit]

      From zucken +‎ -er.

      Noun

      [edit]

      Zucker m (strong, genitive Zuckers, plural Zucker)

      1. (chiefly Austria, informal) a twitching, jerking motion
        Synonym: Zuck
      Declension
      [edit]
      Declension of Zucker [masculine, strong]
      singular plural
      indef. def. noun def. noun
      nominative ein der Zucker die Zucker
      genitive eines des Zuckers der Zucker
      dative einem dem Zucker den Zuckern
      accusative einen den Zucker die Zucker
      Related terms
      [edit]
      • Auszucker

      See also

      [edit]
      • Zuckerl
      • Zuckerberg

      [edit]

      Hunsrik

      [edit]

      Pronunciation

      [edit]
      • IPA(key): /ˈt͡suka/
      • Rhymes: -uka
      • Syllabification: Zuc‧ker

      Noun

      [edit]

      Zucker m (plural Zuckre)

      1. sugar
        Ich drinke Kaffii mit Zucker. ― I drink coffee with sugar.
        Zufiel Zucker is net gud fer die Zeen. ― Too much sugar isn't good for the teeth.

      Derived terms

      [edit]
      • Zuckerbrod
      • Zuckerschot
      • Zuckerstang
      • zuckre
      • zuckrich
